content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the arete. From there, move up the arete on a assortment of holds, reach a right hand gaston (crux), then crank onto the slab via the edges, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two should do it, the landing is great for this problem.
content.location: It ascends the northwest arete on Brick Rock.

content.description:
Sit start with hands matched on the arete. From there, move up the overhang with a left hand on the arete, then work right around the opposite arete, and top it out on the good bumps.

A knee-bar really helps out with reaching the right hand jug at the lip.
content.protection: A few pads, there is large rock that guards the landing.
content.location: This is on the Southwest face of Brick Rock.

content.description:
Cursive ascends a solid, overhanging arete and finishes with a technical topout.

Sit start with hands matched on the arete. From there, work up the arete. At the apex, cross over to a right hand jug, follow with the feet and left hand, then negotiate a techy topout (crux) using the spikes and bumps.
content.protection: A few pads minimum, there is a rock in the fall zone near the top out.
content.location: It ascends the northwest arete and finishes up the south face of Brick Rock.
